ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Down Time
ygData.msgSnippet: WTG MSCE wooot. I have been in IS/IT for 5 years and currently work at Staples Inc on their web systems team.  We do all the work and maitencance on the
ygData.messageBody:
WTG


MSCE wooot.
I have been in IS/IT for 5 years and currently work at
Staples Inc on their web systems team. We do all the
work and maitencance on the 300-400 servers in
production and QA.

A nice field, if you like the techie stuff.

Good Luck, maybe see you online.

What server are you playing on?

Rob

--- shulse7@... wrote:
> Hey Rob,
> Thanks for the help and advice but it mysteriously
> came
> back to life last night as if nothing ever happened!
>
> Damn computers! The problem was that I couldn't even
> get
> to a point where I could run the system restore
> option.
> As I start up the first thing I see is the Dell
> splash
> screen then it would proceed into booting up
> windows.
> Well it would get passed the Dell screen and then
> immediately go to a white screen telling me it
> couldn't
> find any drives. Usually one can boot off a floppy
> or
> CDRom, I couldn't even do that! Being a laptop and
> the
> drives are interchangeable, I wasn't even getting
> power
> to the other drives. I was figuring something went
> wrong
> with the SCSI management on a hardware basis and
> that
> the only repair option was to send it in. I hadn't
> contacted Dell yet, I was mostly venting and
> throwing a
> fit. ;-) When I went to Dell's site to chat with
> support
> the stupid thing started working again and has been
> fine
> ever since. I uninstalled SP3 though!
> My level is pretty good, thanks for the
> consideration,
> not to many people are that way anymore. I'm getting
>
> ready to test on my Win2k MCSE so wish me luck!
>
> Thanks again!
> Steve
>
